humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: According to the pathology report, 9 out of 10 lymph nodes were positive for metastases (Axillary 9/10). Based on the new rules provided, N2 indicates metastases in 4 to 9 axillary lymph nodes. Therefore, the N stage for this patient's cancer is N2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The patient's pathology report indicates that 9 out of 10 examined lymph nodes demonstrated metastases. Based on the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) staging system, the N stage for a patient with cancer metastasis in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes is N1, while the N stage for a patient with cancer metastasis in 4 to 9 axillary lymph nodes is N2. Therefore, the N stage for this patient is N2. The report does not provide information about extracapsular extension, which is not required to determine the N stage in this case.
